channel.title: GParted
channel.description: Im trying to partition my hard drive to install ubuntu using the GParted live cd, but when i get to the last step of the setup, i cant get to the graphical interface. i get a Fatal Error: no screens available. does anybody know how to fix that? or of any other partitioner i can use without wiping my drive (main internal hard drive)?

item.title: GParted
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Move to linux section?

Read full topic

item.title: GParted
item.dc:creator: @robocz033 robocz033
item.description:
@robocz033 wrote:

i just got norton partion magic 8 and did it. i thought i wiped my drive at first, but i didnt. so now ubuntu is installing.

Read full topic

item.title: GParted
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

I assume you’re using the GPartEd Live CD. If so, you might have to choose certain options (when it asks you if you would like to use certain drivers, etc) Choose the resolution it suggest, and you’ll be just fine.

If you’re using ubuntu’s partitioner, download the GPartEd livecd, and just set the drives manually in ubuntu’s install

GPartED Live CD iso: http://download.tuxfamily.org/gpartedlive/gparted-livecd-0.3.4-10.iso (51 MiB)

Read full topic

item.title: GParted
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Use an XP partitioner to set up the partitions first before using the Install on the Live CD.

Presuming your trying to dualboot ofcourse.

Read full topic
